caption: Takeout has been exceptional = excellent food at reasonable prices. Fun to discover a neighborhood gem in the midst of the pandemic. Can't wait to try Endive as a proper dine-in experience.

DELICIOUS. Just picked up their Valentines Day dinner for takeout...cooked to PERFECTION. I can’t say ENOUGH good things about getting takeout from this amazing restaurant! We have always loved going to Endive pre-pandemic, but their takeout is EVEN better! Perfectly prepped, seasoned and never overcooked...we are stuffed and happy from this fantastic meal!
Awesome neighborhood restaurant. Great food and service.

We've loved this restaurant from the first time we ate there. We have also used the catering service for a private in-home dinner and with the advent of the pandemic have used the pick up service as well. Everything about Endive has been a pleasure, from reliably delicious meals to great service and ultra-reasonable prices. Try the salmon or the  sea bass and don't miss out on the grits.
If you are a fan of CLAM CHOWDER, Endive has the absolutely BEST in Atlanta!  I challenge every lover of Clam Chowder to get yourself some and give it a try.
One of my favorite restaurants in Atlanta! Food is amazing, staff is always so great! And the price is just right! A hidden gem for sure!
Visited Sat afternoon. Looking forward to returning with my friends. The bill was reasonable.
My favorite location for tasty american food. there was fast, efficient, and courteous service. not close to my job, i wish it was.
good fast food shop for a quick bite.

One of our go-to restaurants before quarantine.  They’ve shown they care about the safety of their staff and their customers by taking excellent precautions for distancing and cleanliness.  I can’t believe how quickly they were able to flex to do curbside pickup.  They just started opening the restaurant for dine in.  They’ve removed extra tables and chairs at the bar so everyone is appropriately spaced.  Staff is wearing masks and gloves.  Each table has its own hand sanitizer.  Menus are one time use.  Don’t want to be inside yet?  they’ve added some outdoor seating if you want to enjoy your “to go” order on site - no table service but you can still go in to grab a drink inside.  If you aren’t ready for that, they’ve still got curbside orders.  Please come show your support to a restaurant that is taking the time to open slow and safe!!!
This spot provides wonderful service and enjoyable food. The best spot around town. The food came out quick and the rates are affordable. Will definitely recommend this restaurant.
The food was outstanding and the dining room was not overly loud. I was told the bartender makes the best old fashioned and I was not disappointed.

This is such a great place to go for dinner for so many different groups of people. We always go with our teenagers who also love the food and atmosphere. When my mother in law comes into town she also choose it as one of her favorite places to dine. It is not a large restaurant which I also like and you are never rushed to finish. We have never been disappointed with our meals either.

Awesome quaint little neighborhood bistro that grew out of a fantastic catering company. Very welcoming atmosphere with a wonderful and knowledgeable staff.  The food is excellent ... and I have tried a variety of items on the menu and always delighted. Tonight was no different. I was amazed with my choice of the soy/bourbon salmon. It was described with an accompanying medley of vegetables. Our server recommended to substitute the cheddar grits which I did and it was excellent.  Wonderful ambiance, great staff and food.

Terrific dining experience.  Was able to reserve a table for 4 early on a Saturday.  Apps were absolutely spectacular.  Duck & fig jam flatbread,  mushroom dip with root veggie chips and the hummus medley.  The flavors, texture and presentation were great.  3 of us ordered salmon (well prepared and presented but not thrilling) and the fourth had lamb shank.  We shared the dessert which was also very good - a samping of three items.  Cocktail preparation and selection of beers were also well received.  One of our guests is a brewer and super aficionado of beer and he was pleased.  Can't wait to go back.
Great place to know about... Hidden gem!
Loved the lobster! Excellent service
Everything here was just about perfect.  Wonderful drinks, small plates, entree and dessert.  This is worth going out of your way for.
Great food and ambiance
Great atmosphere.  Food was delicious.

Fabulous spot! The food is consistently good and the cocktails are on point. We love y'all, Endive. My wife and I went here after some serious wedding planning and needing a break, after she got a new job and needing to celebrate, after putting an offer on a house and needing to unwind, and on less notable occasions too. It's never disappointed us.
Great ambiance, great food, overall just a fantastic experience.
My honey John felt I was overdue for a night out. Great atmosphere. The food was superb and our hostess Billy was the best! Special thanks to the Chef!
Very good...I was pleasantly surprised!
One of my favorite places in Atlanta. Food is always perfect and cooked fresh.
Save room for dessert!

We went for dinner at the recommendation of friends that had been before and were not disappointed. Interesting, yet comfortable ambiance, good service and excellent food. We had their “trio dip”, and chicken fingers as appetizers, both were excellent. Yes, the chicken fingers are worthy of being an appetizer and were excellent. Be careful, after the dip and appetizer you might begin to feel full! I had their fish-of-the-day, which was excellent Chilean Salmon. But, order the sides, the potatoes, the squash, the grits, yum! We were not able to make it to desert as we were “stuffed”. But the desert at the next table looked awesome. Anyway, six drinks, two appetizers, four entrees (well three salads, with sides and one entree) ended up being about $160 or so.
Great menu and very cool place to eat.

This intimate restaurant is great for a date or Katy a dinner with friends.  It’s a diverse menu so anyone can find something to eat.  Innovative cocktails and stellar desserts are key components.   Close to Atlantic Station and perfect to have dinner before or after Cirque de Soleil Volta
Eclectic. Original. Outstanding!
INCREDIBLE
The greatest hidden gem of a resteraunt in the city of Atlanta.
Great food and atmosphere. Never had a bad time.

The food was excellent.  I had the Patagonia salmon.  We enjoyed a private room for a birthday party for a friend.  The room was reserved that day.  Our server was friendly, funny and knowledgeable.  We had a great time.  Prices were very reasonable and service was excellent.  I will most definitely be back.
Small restaurant setting with big flavor foods. Definitely a must eat at neighborhood restaurant

My boyfriend and I love to walk here and have a date night. The food is always fantastic, and we never miss out on the cocktails.  The staff is very friendly, and because it’s a small place, it’s fairly easy to grab them when you need something.  I have yet to try their catering, but I bet it’s phenomenal.
Quaint place with a casual atmosphere. Well prepared food tender steak and awesome fried lobster tail.

Nice quiet atmosphere good for conversation. The restaurant is small and cozy. The food was tasty, maybe a bit over salted, but a nice variety. Everything was hot and well cooked. Service was very good. Overall an excellent date night.

Delicious, fresh, outstanding are just a few words to describe this private neighborhood gem. Classic cocktails and desserts to die for. Love the atmosphere and they have a private dining room as well. Only open 3 days each week.
Went to endive for anniversary and the service and food top notch. Best place we've eaten in Atlanta!
Friendly service, great food; I recommend the crab cake small plate. Paired with a salad, it makes a full meal. Good mixed drinks as well
Lovely dinner...has an inventive menu
Wonderful birthday dinner here. Food and service were outstanding! Can’t wait to go back!!!
Every dish is absolutely amazing!
One word: A M A Z I N G! My husband and I met the gentleman in the blue blazer with his lovely wife tonight! Great staff and customers!!
Fantastic neighborhood spot under the radar.
Great food and service. A real gem.

Truly a hidden gem. This tiny restaurant tucked away in a residential neighborhood serves up outstanding culinary treats. Beer list is small but well curated. The craft cocktails are creative and perfectly composed. 5/5 all around.

The food - from appetizer to main course to desert - are all fantastic. The service is excellent as well. If you like like seafood (I don't), you'll probably love this place. If you don't, the filet is delicious.  It's a little on the pricey side, but you actually do get a decent amount of food. What's best is that it's a little quieter and roomier than a a lot so-called trendy restaurants in the city.  I would recommend.
The lamb shank though... This place is any foodie's wet dream.
Didn't know this place existed until today and I'm so glad I found it. The flavors here we're off the charts. Highly recommended.
Great food.

We have been here several times, most recently for Valentine's day. I can definitely say that the service here is very good, with wait staff that know their stuff. The food is also excellent, and the dishes are unique in their own way. Keep in mind you get what you pay for, this the food is quite expensive. My only other complaint would be a lack of draft beer, so try a cocktail instead!
Beautiful restaurant
Great food, very nice staff...but no endives served there 😉
The food was the best of this genre we have had. We are local and have many different varieties of the same. Good service and great taste.

Excellent food and service.  For such wonderfully prepared food, it is very reasonably priced. Located in a hard-to-find location, this is a neighborhood gem that we are going to frequent for time.  Cannot recommend highly enough!
Little hard to find due to construction but was worth every turn! Megan our server was AMAZING!!!! Food & drinks nothing short of stellar.... We will b back for sure. ❤
Everything was amazing. Food, cocktails, service, and atmosphere. Our server, Gen, was very kind, fun, and attentive. I will definitely be back.
Very inventive and delicious food. Unlike any other restaurant. Highly recommend!
My favorite restaurant that's across the street from my apartment
I went for a food tasting and tried several different things, all of them were uniquely delicious. Creative chef with beautiful presentation.
This restaurant is amazing. Great food and great service. Although it may be a bit expensive, it is awesome.

Great place. I would give 5 stars, but I've only been the one time.  Great Rob Collins. Interesting menu and cool atmosphere.  Highlight was definitely desert.  They had this bread pudding made out if Krispy Kreme doughnuts.  Awesome.  The strawberry shortcake was also delicious.  All in it was about $80.  Very good value for the wonderful food and environment.
Incredible food, enjoyable atmosphere amazing servers, overall great experience.

Endive is like a neighborhood gem meets city secret. Tucked away in Loring Heights, this caterer turned restaurateur is churning out solid food. The chicken wanton tacos and the mushroom dip were the stuff of dreams! The plating was works of art and the dishes weren’t overly sauced. Intimate setting. Great ambiance and BUSY. Reservations are a must. There are so many great things on the menu to keep you coming back for more. I highly recommend this place for a date night, girls night out, or an I don’t want to cook night.
The service and food were excellent!!!
Oh! The drinks and apps and filet. The sea bass was so great also. We made reservations forn6 and were seated immediately. Laura was a great server. Highly recommended.
Unbelievable!

This is my favorite restaurant in Midtown! The food is always incredible and the craft cocktails are delicious. The GM, Tony, has taken great care of me over the years, as well as my family and friends. Special shout out to the best waiter, Seamus!
Great food great people overall great place to eat
Excellent food great service and if you need awesome food for your wedding this place to call for catering as well for your events!
Great place to eat.
It was a great experience. The food and service was excellent.

We had reservations at 8:30 for a party of 4 on a Saturday night, but we weren’t seated until 9:40. We hung out at the bar and got drinks (all between $8-$11). The manager and a couple other waiters came over to apologize for the wait. The manager offered some appetizers on the house, which we appreciated. We ordered the fried green tomatoes and chicken tacos. The waiter recommended that we also try the calamari fries (adding that since it was on the house, why not?). We were glad that we tried the calamari too! It was delicious. We all enjoyed the small plates.  We got the Korean BBQ ($16) which was really just meat and bread. While the meat was very nicely flavored, I do wish there was a veggie side to balance out the heaviness of the meat and bread.  The salmon and grits ($19) were a little bland.  The dijon-roasted chicken breast ($16) was very flavorful and cooked nicely.  We got the roasted butternut squash gratin side ($6), which was very good!  The dessert sampler ($9) was impossible to pass up. My favorite was the chocolate cheesecake. The strawberry shortcake dessert was a little too sweet. The coconut cake dessert was good too. We split it between 4 people, and it was the perfect amount.  I felt that everything was reasonably priced, though with the drinks, it does add up!  We felt well taken care of with the small plates, which is why I am giving endive 5 stars. While the entrees left some to be desired, the delicious small plates and the ambiance of the restaurant and the bar make it worth coming back!
awesome time at this place. surprised I haven't heard of it until now. also surprised they're only open 3 days a week!
Great food and atmosphere.
Great quiet place with amazing food!
Food was delicious!
Great food, kind staff. The atmosphere is low key but classy. Not too pretentious for the location.
Food is incredible. From appetizers to dessert, the whole meal was wonderful.
Lovely meal though in an unconventional location

Incredible.  This was a bit nicer place than I was expecting.  Not necessarily jacket and tie but I went in with a baseball cap and felt a little underdressed.  Not terribly expensive for the quality of food.  My wife had the sea bass and I had the Korean barbecue pot roast and tomatoes mozzarella salad.  The food was absolutely amazing.  Not a very big place but excellent!  Never seen such a high Google rating but it definitely deserves it.
Food was delicious and the dessert trio was a great way to end the dinner!  We were seated right away and Billy, our server, was awesome!

Small, well appointed space. Perfect vibe for a relaxing intimate dinner. The food is outstanding. Service is fantastic. You can tell they actually care that you are enjoying your evening. Definitely not a place to bring unruly children.
Great atmosphere.

We used Endive Catering for our wedding earlier this month. AMAZING from start to finish. The service, the prices, and the FOOD are just impeccable. We couldn't be happier. We got so many compliments from our guests about the food at the wedding - YUMMY. Chef Drew - We went in for a tasting and Chef D hooked us up with an incredible spread. The presentation was amazing and the food was top notch. Very creative but yummy! Julia - Where do I begin? Julia was like my wedding bestie! From my first call with her to the last second, she was on it! Very approachable, which isn't always the case with wedding vendors. Very patient and kind. Her entire being makes you feel so safe and comfortable. I was sad that the wedding process was almost over because I knew I'd have to end all my communications with her! hahaa. But seriously, she made my wedding planning process a breeze! We've decided that we're going back to Endive every year at least once around our anniversary to remember the magic they made on our special day. CHOOSE them for your wedding/events. I'm a huge food critic and so is my family. We all LOVED the food but mostly, the people at Endive are magical beings! LOVE LOVE LOVE!!!
The manager is amazing, Great place for date night or friends night out. The food is always on point. The deserts are always fun and exciting
This is the best restaurant in Atlanta, their daily dessert is always great.
Amazing food & great service!  My favorite weekend spot.

My husband and I recently used Endive catering for our cocktail hour and wedding reception. Every dish was phenomenal! Our guests raved about each dish from the passed or dourness to the plated entrees. We could not have been more impressed with the quality and presentation of our food. Julia and Endive were very personable and helpful throughout the process as well!

The food and cocktails were phenomenal; however, the only downfall was that I made a reservation for the tasting room at 9:00pm and we did not get seated until 9:45pm. We also were not seated in the tasting room. They were really busy so it's understandable but it was annoying. In any case, I had the Gypsy cocktail and it was quite refreshing. My party mostly ordered small plates and sides; the plating was very elegant and everything was delicious. I would come here again.
A 10 ! ..... Best On All Points

The food is always amazing! The restaurant's atmosphere is great for a date night or a small group dinner. The duck pizza appetizer is my favorite. The salmon is always cooked so perfectly. Most places overcook their salmon and it ends up dry, but not endive. The Korean BBQ chuck roast is another delicious choice. I love the twice-baked potato side dish too. Staff is friendly and attentive. Be sure to make a reservation.  The also cater events. Our wedding planner recommended we try them and we're so glad we did. Theirs was the best tasting we attended as far as taste and presentation. They provided this HUGE tray with a variety of their apps, sides, and entrees. It actually brought a tear to my then fiance's eye. If I remember correctly, there's a minimum spend, so be aware. So highly recommended! We can also get some of the same menu items at the restaurant, so that a bonus when our anniversary rolls around and we're feeling nostalgic.
Always amazing food, super friendly service and reasonable prices

Loved it! We went for a birthday celebration, and they took great care of us. It was an amazing meal - great presentation, great quality, and it was very reasonably priced. There's something for everyone on the menu. The mushroom dip is a must-try!
One of the best restaurants in town.  Superior food, service and experience.
Amazing modern American food for really good prices. The ambience is great and so are the servers. Would definitely come back. Do check the hours and call for reservations.
The atmosphere and food was really good!
Great food! Great people!
This might be my new favorite restaurant in Atlanta. The food is delicious, the atmosphere is laid back and charming, and the prices are unbelievable. Definitely worth checking out!!
Yum!! Everything is so delicious. I especially love a desert sampler. Great food, atmosphere, and staff!
Delightful selection at affordable prices.
Cozy setting, professional, friendly service, delicious food, ample portions. Love the cornflake chicken tenders, duck pizza, lobster tails and fresh sushi.
Fantastic service and presentation of dishes!
Beautifully prepared and presented food, great service
Nice and cozy little place tucked away off the beaten path near Atlantic Station, small portions but very tasty.......good drinks
This place is so good, great price and taste is awesome
Excellent food, excellent service.  Just Thurs-Sat, though.
Brilliant!  A must try.

Foremost, Endive completely changed our expectations associated with catered food. We were completely blown away by the quality of food and excellent service. Chef Drew worked closely with us to select the perfect menu for our wedding. They accommodated our dietary restrictions and encouraged us to customize our meal (mix and match across stations) without hesitation. From the very beginning, we were also worked with Endive’s event coordinator. She was pivotal throughout and helped us plan each element of the meal. Endive (through working with other vendors) also arranged the dining area, including the setup and cleaning. The staff (stations, servers and bartenders) were focused and very courteous. Finally, the coordinator helped with overall planning and worked closely with our wedding planners to ensure everything ran smoothly. We received overwhelmingly positive feedback from our guests. It was the best wedding food many of us have ever experienced. We cannot recommend Endive enough; it was an absolute pleasure working with them.
Wonderful food with a cozy environment.  Good wine selection with a reasonable corkage fee.

This review is for Endive Fine Catering.  Chef Drew and Noelle were amazing to work with for our wedding on 5/24/2015. They really listened to what we wanted for our guests and were willing to work with our budget where other vendors wouldn't. Our guests have not stopped talking about how good the food was and how many options there were to enjoy. On top of all of this, they really took care of us and our families : they made sure that my husband and I had appetizers and food prepared for us and they also took care of special requests for my brother who is allergic to gluten and dairy. Overall - you will be far from disappointed if you use Endive for your wedding :)
awesome
A true Atlanta hidden gem! Amazing food, romantic setting, and a great place to host private parties! Save this place for special occasions! #cityexperts

We had a few tastings for our wedding, Endive was our last one. As soon as we walked out the door, my then fiance and I looked at each other and said that's our caterer! We worked with Noelle & Chef Drew, they were both amazing to work with. The food was out of this world, the wedding was 3 months ago and we're still getting compliments on them. When searching for caterers we were told Endive was on the high end, but they were lower than many other companies we looked at. The best part was the to-go food they made for us to take after the wedding! I could go on and on, let's just say if I ever need a caterer again I know where I'll go!

endive just opened to the public in March 2014 (previously & currently a well-known catering company). They have a great space with a fun, neighborhood feel. The small plates are especially amazing - they take care to make everything in-house, and you can tell b/c everything comes out just right. The drinks are solid as well - with amazing talent at crafting new unique drinks (however, I think people would order more if they had a selection of house specialty drinks). A must-try Atlanta restaurant.

I couldn't be more pleased or impressed with endive catering.  We hosted a Birthday Party this past weekend and it was enhanced 100% by the food and service from from endive. Andrea, Matt and Brian were awesome and the presentation, taste and professionalism were near perfection.  They went out of their way to impress all the guests while accommodating any and all of my requests. Do not hesitate when booking for your next event....you wont be disappointed!

Endive was absolutely amazing. We hired Endive to cater our wedding and definitely made the right choice. Chef Drew is awesome and easy to work with and we loved his desire to source locally and only use the very best ingredients. We knew from our tasting that we would have the best food available in Atlanta and we were right! Our guests raved about everything on the menu and working with Carol and Drew was an absolutely pleasure. HIGHLY RECOMMEND Endive catering :).

Endive Catering is the way to go!!!  We had a wedding reception of about 215 people at a brewery (we had a small destination wedding).  The scene was casual and we had passed hors d'oeuvres and two "stations" of food.  By stations I mean two awesome spreads with multiple options each!  Endive Catering went above and beyond the call of duty, not only helping me with the catering/food side of things, but really acted as an event planner, decorator, and trusted advisor throughout the whole thing.  They were instrumental to the success of the party.  From the moment we met with Endive, we knew they were the best choice for us.  They were reasonably priced but offered outstanding food and customer service.  Having our party in a brewery as it was, we weren't trying to do anything overly fancy that didn't fit the space.  Endive worked with our vision of a casual, fun party and guided us in decisions to bring that to life. (though I have no doubts they could also rock a formal 7 course dinner party) They were never pushy or tried to add on expenses we didn't need.  I sincerely felt they had my best interests in mind. Shout out to Julia, who was incredible and I already miss talking to!  All of our guests raved about the food, the friendliness of the staff Endive provided, and how we turned an industrial brewery into an attractive, intimate event space.  Thank you Endive for helping me throw an awesome party for our guests!  I will not hesitate to use you again!

Endive provided the catering for my wedding on February 2, 2013.  They were FABULOUS!!  The planning process started with Carol and Rhys.  They both took a lot of time to explain all of the different processes for our wedding reception.  They carefully reviewed the contract and types of menus.  Carol took so much time to help us decide what format to use and floor plan.  IT was incredibly helpful.  Now let's talk about the food.  It is obviously food that the chef, Drew, takes great pride in creating.  The food he prepares is beautiful...that is the only word I can use to describe it.  My new husband and I got countless text messages, Facebook posts, emails and phone calls from guests at the reception to tell us how much they enjoyed the food at our reception!!  We agreed.  Carol helped us decide which wines to purchase that would pair perfectly with each appetizer and entree.  I would highly suggest the Maryland crab fritters, slow simmered short ribs, chicken tagine and bourbon glazed salmon. The food is so fresh and beautifully prepared.  I am so incredibly happy with Endive and would recommend them to anyone that enjoys great food.  The price was also outstanding!  You can not get such high quality food for such a great price anywhere else.  The service, price and most importantly, the food was incredible!  Thank you Endive!!
